org.dellroad.muxable.simple

Interface ProtocolReader.InputHandler

  • Enclosing class:
    ProtocolReader

    public static interface ProtocolReader.InputHandler
    Callback interface invoked by a ProtocolReader.

    Channel ID's are long values between one and Long.MAX_VALUE, inclusive. To disambiguate local vs. remote channels, local channel ID's are encoded as their positive values, while remote channel ID's are encoded as the negative of their values (note: zero is not a valid channel ID).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void nestedChannelClosed(long channelId)
      An existing nested channel has been closed by the remote side.
      void nestedChannelData(long channelId, ByteBuffer data)
      Data has been received on a nested channel.
      void nestedChannelRequest(long channelId, ByteBuffer requestData, Directions directions)
      A new nested channel request has been received.

    • Method Detail

      • nestedChannelRequest

        void nestedChannelRequest(long channelId,
                          ByteBuffer requestData,
                          Directions directions)
                   throws IOException
        A new nested channel request has been received.

        Because the channel was created by the remote side, channelId will always be negative.

        Parameters:
        channelId - the encoded channel ID of the new nested channel (always negative)
        requestData - associated request data (read-only)
        directions - which I/O direction(s) are being established (from the local point of view)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • nestedChannelData

        void nestedChannelData(long channelId,
                       ByteBuffer data)
                throws IOException
        Data has been received on a nested channel.

        Note that it's possible to receive data on a nested channel after the local side has closed that channel, because the remote side may not yet know that the nested channel has been closed.

        Parameters:
        channelId - the encoded ID of a nested channel (postive for local channels, negative for remote channels)
        data - new channel data
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • nestedChannelClosed

        void nestedChannelClosed(long channelId)
                  throws IOException
        An existing nested channel has been closed by the remote side.

        No more incoming data will appear on the specified nested channel.

        Although nested channels are in general bidirectional, both directions are opened and closed at the same time. This method implies both the incoming and outgoing directions are being closed.

        Parameters:
        channelId - the encoded ID of an open nested channel (postive for local channels, negative for remote channels)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
